rev.comment: /* DRM in Google Video */ noted that it is U.S. only (though I'm not 100% sure about that)
rev.diff:
Line 237: Line 237:
===DRM in Google Video===
===DRM in Google Video===
â
Announced on [[January 6]], [[2006]] at the CES in Las Vegas, the Google Video Store sells copyrighted content at the Google Video website. To protect the copyright of these popular shows such as [[MacGyver]] and [[The Twilight Zone]], Google created a Google DRM ([[digital rights management]]) lock for certain paid content. The fact by itself that Google was using DRM was enough to cause criticism by some bloggers, even before Google Video was launched. The design of the system also has minor privacy implications that Google does not explain on their Video site; namely, Google learns who purchases each movie and what computers they watch it on. [http://www.freedom-to-tinker.com/?p=956] It is unknown whether the Google Video Player software sends personal information to Google, as in [[Windows Media Player]]; Google has not commented on this.
+
Announced on [[January 6]], [[2006]] at the CES in Las Vegas, the Google Video Store sells copyrighted content at the Google Video website. Initially this service is restricted to the United States. <!--I think, doesn't work in the UK anyway--> To protect the copyright of these popular shows such as [[MacGyver]] and [[The Twilight Zone]], Google created a Google DRM ([[digital rights management]]) lock for certain paid content. The fact by itself that Google was using DRM was enough to cause criticism by some bloggers, even before Google Video was launched. The design of the system also has minor privacy implications that Google does not explain on their Video site; namely, Google learns who purchases each movie and what computers they watch it on. [http://www.freedom-to-tinker.com/?p=956] It is unknown whether the Google Video Player software sends personal information to Google, as in [[Windows Media Player]]; Google has not commented on this.
